title: Why does dodging a ranked promos game count as a loss?
body:
I just baaarely made it to silver 2 today. Thank Riot for the promotion forgiveness free win thing, because both of my last promo games had intentional feeders in it. And my first promo game today had one too! He said he was going to feed in champion select, but I figured might as well play y'know? Since dodging counts as a loss anyway. It went as well as you'd expect. I know it's going to be crazy these last few days of the season, especially since it seems every other player is boosted or trolling. 

And I do understand this could be abused. In your promo and you don't like your teamcomp? Just dodge. But consider this; the good would outweigh the bad. There will be so many more people dodging to avoid a troll than dodging to... abuse this or whatever. And it's not a perfect Sol {{champion:236}} by any means, but until Riot implements a way to deal with these kinds of things, we sort of need a way to dodge these trolls. The queue time increase (5-20 minutes) is a good deterrent as well. 

It's just so miserable to climb when trolls have access to your information. "He's in promos," they might think to themselves. "I'm already gold so idc. Time to get my feed on!" Thankfully I have trust in Riot's punishment system (as seen by so many threads here) but it doesn't fix the damage already done. So.. yea?

replies.body:
Did you consider that people would just dodge every single game they got in promos until they got a draft where someone picks urgot support on the enemy team and virtually promises a win for them?

If you really want to dodge just say in chat "Hey guys this guy is clearly going to feed. I'm on my promos, does anyone have the kindness in their heart to dodge so I don't lose a promo cause of this fuk?"

Good suggestion. 

And no, literally nobody would do that lol. I dodge once it's a 5 minute wait. I dodge again and it's an insanely long wait. And you have to be there when the wait is done; if you miss that game pop up you have to wait for the entire time all over again. You also can't invite or have friends leave the lobby or it resets.

> [{quoted}](name=Revan Senpai,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=0R52AYWR,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2016-11-01T11:35:54.589+0000)
>And you have to be there when the wait is done; if you miss that game pop up you have to wait for the entire time all over again. You also can't invite or have friends leave the lobby or it resets.

That's not how it works at all. I just go to a custom game and practice CSing for 15 mins then pop back in.
I might be getting it confused with leaverbuster?
Avoiding unfavorable drafts would be an unfair advantage during a series.

> [{quoted}](name=Breaku,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=0R52AYWR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-01T09:27:20.295+0000)
>
> Avoiding unfavorable drafts would be an unfair advantage during a series.

How is it an unfair advantage when everyone has access to do the same thing? You could say it will increase queue times or some shit but it's not an unfair advantage.

Losing a draft is part of losing the game.

At higher ELO you can even be banned for dodging too many times.

> [{quoted}](name=Breaku,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=0R52AYWR,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2016-11-01T12:13:11.481+0000)
>
> Losing a draft is part of losing the game.
> 
> At higher ELO you can even be banned for dodging too many times.

Being that you have no control over who people pick in a PUG, how is that a fair demonstration of someone's skill? That's why dodging exists, if your random teammates pick an awful team comp. 

I have never heard of anyone getting banned for dodging too many times or a rule stating this. Citation?

You can dodge a normal ranked game, though, because of an unfavorable draft? You lose like 3 LP. Personally, I gain 22 LP per win. So I can dodge seven ranked games with no consequence or loss, but I can't dodge a single promo game?

I have seen loads of people dodge for any reason. You cannot know if the people would abuse a system like this,but it is somewhat obvious of their intentions. This is rank and people will do what ever it takes to get a free win. If dodging was a thing then too much people could abuse it to get that one up, doesn't like the team comp (from either team), ban (didn't ban) a certain champion people would dodge, just to mess with people and leave at the last second. It's crazy how some people would abuse it but it could happen. And that's the reason why they don't want to do it. If you can prove the goods outweighs the bad and give evidence to back up your claim I'm sure a Rioter would listen. But just assuming they wouldn't with how people are now isn't helping.

I agree I've seen a LOT of dodging. But with the queue times, it's just unrealistic to dodge more than once. You'd have to wait like 20 minutes. Plus I mean, you can dodge in a normal ranked game y'know? This isn't a new feature or anything. You just can't dodge in a promo ranked game.

your queue times may be low during peak hours.

What about the non-peak hours?

what about the high ELO?

what about the high ELO on non-peak hours?

If people are allowed to dodge for free, then people will enver get into a game in those ELOs.
It gives you a loss in series/promo as punishment. You should not be dodging in ranked.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751844-Queue-Dodging

"Queue dodging happens when a player in champion select decides to leave the lobby for any reason. When one player dodges, the remaining players on both teams are placed back into the matchmaking queue and the leaving player suffers a penalty depending on the game queue they are currently in."
Thanks, but I know what queue dodging is? Lol. If you do it during a promo game it counts as a loss.
